You're now running Android Studio 3.2. Learn more about new features and behavior changes below. You can also read the full release notes in a browser or watch a video overview on YouTube.

To open this panel again later, select Help > What's New in Android Studio from the main menu.

Support for Dynamic Apps

Dynamic Apps is an easier way to update and deploy your app to an ever-growing ecosystem of diverse Android devices. With Dynamic Apps, you need to build and upload only a single build artifact, the Android App Bundle, to support all target device configurations.

App stores that support Dynamic Apps—such as the Google Play Store—build, sign, and manage APKs for all versions of your app for you, and push only the code and resources a device requires to run your app. Updates to Android Studio and the Android Plugin for Gradle allow you to configure your app project to take advantage of Dynamic Apps and build Android App Bundles.



To learn more about how to configure your project to support Dynamic Apps, read the following documentation in a browser.

  • About Dynamic Apps
  • Modularize Your Project for Split APKs
  • Control APK Downloads with PlayCore API
  • Test Dynamic Apps with BundleTool
  • Build and Upload Android App Bundles

      • Navigation Editor

      The Navigation Editor lets you visualize and edit navigation behavior between different components and activities in your app, so you can better assess whether navigation flows are correct and easy for users to understand. To learn more, read the documentation in a browser.



      New Energy Profiler

      The Android Profiler now includes an Energy Profiler to help you assess the energy consumption of your app. This profiler visualizes your app's battery usage and allows you to inspect which device components—such as network radios or the CPU—are consuming the most energy.


      New Code Shrinker

      R8 is a new tool for code shrinking and obfuscation that replaces ProGuard. You can start using a preview version of R8 by including the following in your project’s gradle.properties file: 

        android.enableR8 = true
